meanings.definition: The act of expressing oneself in words.
meanings.sent1: Her verbalizations during the presentation were clear and easy to understand.
meanings.sent2: The teacher encouraged more verbalizations from the students in class.
meanings.sent3: His verbalizations about wanting pizza for breakfast made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The verbalizations of the birds in the morning created a symphony of sound.
meanings.sent5: The therapist used verbalizations to help the child express their feelings.

meanings.sent1: The loud verbalizations of the actor echoed through the theater.
meanings.sent2: The baby's verbalizations were a mix of babbling and cooing.
meanings.sent3: The verbalizations of the auctioneer kept the crowd engaged and excited.
meanings.sent4: The verbalizations of the protesters could be heard from far away.
meanings.sent5: The verbalizations of the news anchor were clear and authoritative.

meanings.definition: The process of converting thoughts into spoken words.
meanings.sent1: Effective verbalizations require clarity and coherence.
meanings.sent2: The therapist helped the patient improve their verbalizations through practice.
meanings.sent3: The verbalizations of the poet flowed effortlessly, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent4: The verbalizations of the translator bridged the language barrier seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: His verbalizations in the debate were well-reasoned and persuasive.
